trans-unit.source: Represents indexing a property or array.
Gets the arguments that will be used to index the property or array.
The read-only collection containing the arguments that will be used to index the property or array.
Gets the <xref href="System.Reflection.PropertyInfo"></xref> for the property if the expression represents an indexed property, returns null otherwise.
The <xref href="System.Reflection.PropertyInfo"></xref> for the property if the expression represents an indexed property, otherwise null.
Returns the node type of this <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.Expression"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType"></xref> that represents this expression.
An object to index.
The <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.Expression"></xref> representing the object to index.
Gets the static type of the expression that this <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.Expression"></xref> represents.
The <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.IndexExpression.Type"></xref> that represents the static type of the expression.
Creates a new expression that is like this one, but using the supplied children.
If all of the children are the same, it will return this expression.
The <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.IndexExpression.Object"></xref> property of the result.
The <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.IndexExpression.Arguments"></xref> property of the result.
This expression if no children are changed or an expression with the updated children.
Returns the number of arguments to the expression tree node.
You should not use this member.
It is only public due to assembly refactoring, and it is used internally for performance optimizations.
Returns <xref href="System.Int32"></xref>.
Returns the argument at index, throwing if index is out of bounds.
You should not use this member.
It is only public due to assembly refactoring, and it is used internally for performance optimizations.
The index of the argument.
Returns <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.Expression"></xref>.
